DataElement.preferredDefinition: the assessment used to determine if a patient/participant is premenopausal.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the assessment to determine if a patient/participant is premenopausal, the time of life when a women's menstrual periods stop permanently.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Refers to the time before menopause. Menopause is the time of life when a women's menstrual periods stop permanently; also called "change of life.":Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of assessment used to determine premenopausal status.

PermissibleValues.value: Patient did NOT receive chemotherapy, patient menstruating regularly and has not had any hormonal contraception or treatment during the 6 months before randomization
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Patient did NOT receive chemotherapy, patient menstruating regularly and has not had any hormonal contraception or treatment during the 6 months before randomization

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Patient did NOT receive chemotherapy, patient menstruating regularly and has not had any hormonal contraception or treatment during the 6 months before randomization
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Patient did NOT receive chemotherapy, patient menstruating regularly and has not had any hormonal contraception or treatment during the 6 months before randomization

PermissibleValues.value: Amenorrheic due to hormonal contraception use but greater than or equal to 4 menstrual cycles within the last 6 months prior to starting on contraceptive
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Amenorrheic due to hormonal contraception use but greater than or equal to 4 menstrual cycles within the last 6 months prior to starting on contraceptive

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Amenorrheic due to hormonal contraception use but greater than or equal to 4 menstrual cycles within the last 6 months prior to starting on contraceptive

PermissibleValues.value: Greater than or equal to 4 menstrual cycles within the last 6 months

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Greater than or equal to 4 menstrual cycles within the last 6 months

PermissibleValues.value: Less than 4 menstrual cycles within the last 6 months OR hysterectomy with ovaries intact, if FSH level less than 20
